java.lang

Class String

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.String
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, CharSequence, Comparable<String>

    public final class String
extends Object
implements Serializable, Comparable<String>, CharSequence
    MJI adapter for java.lang.String, based on jdk 1.7.0_07 source. Adapted by frank. We have to model java.lang.String since it changed its implementation between Java 1.6 and Java 1.7, and JPF is initializing string objects internally without doing roundtrips (for performance reasons), i.e. we need to be able to rely on fields of the String implementation. The silver lining is that most methods are now native and don't appear in traces anymore. Spending a lot of JPF cycles (instruction.execute()) on String is just not worth it in terms of potential properties.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
